synopsis_with_character_names: Isabelle, an illicit drug user and a thief, escapes from Paris during the initial outbreak with her boyfriend Quinn and her pregnant sister Lily, before abandoning Quinn. Lily is bitten, and she gives birth as a walker to Laurent at the abbey via emergency C-section. In the present, the group loses their mule and are captured by a group of children who have been living in their old preschool with their dying teacher Madame DuBois. While Laurent makes friends with the other children, needing a horse, Daryl offers to get them the medicine that they need if they help him raid a nearby castle owned by a man dubbed La Tarasque who has been plaguing them. Daryl rescues the imprisoned Hérisson and confronts La Tarasque who is revealed to be an American from Texas named RJ Gaines. Gaines falls into his own walker moat and is devoured, while the kids rescue Daryl. However, Madame DuBois dies of her illness and Daryl encourages Lou to step up as their leader. The group resumes their journey, but Laurent expresses frustration over all of the secrets that are being kept from him. Codron returns to the abandoned abbey where he finds Daryl's recorded message, a picture of Laurent, and a map depicting the group's path to Paris.Isabelle, an illicit drug user and a thief, escapes from Paris during the initial outbreak with her boyfriend Quinn and her pregnant sister Lily, before abandoning Quinn. Daryl rescues the imprisoned Hérisson and confronts La Tarasque who is revealed to be an American from Texas named RJ Gaines. The group resumes their journey, but Laurent expresses frustration over all of the secrets that are being kept from him. Codron returns to the abandoned abbey where he finds Daryl's recorded message, a picture of Laurent, and a map depicting the group's path to Paris.

description: In London, two teams are formed and prepare their operations, destined as adversaries. Michael 'Mickey Bricks' Stone is out of jail after two years for an unrelated offense; everybody knows he will do at least once more what he's good in, in fact the best in Britain: the intricate 'long con', always prepared by his American associate Albert Stroller, who finds and gai... Read all
tags: ['breaking the fourth wall', 'talking to the camera', 'police surveillance', 'police', 'thief', 'fake', 'betrayal', 'surprise ending']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Top London con artist, Mickey Stone - "He's in a class all his own, a long con player" - is out of prison (for GBH on his wife's new boyfriend), and keen to get back in the game. His old team-mates have been busy while he's been inside: Ash doing the flop, Stacie the dip, and Albert's just continued being Albert - but Mickey wants them back together. This will be Mickey's last score before he retires, so it's important he has the right team.



Danny Blue is a short-con artist, playing the cards, Find the Lady, Poker, anything to improve his skill. But he's desperate to do a long con. Whilst hanging out at London's renowned con artists' bar, Eddie's, he learns that Mickey 'Bricks' Stone is out. Keen to learn from the master, Danny sets off in search of the man behind the legend. However, despite his ability to talk the talk, Danny can't blag his way into Mickey's hotel room. He'll need a better in, if he's going to join this team.

"This crew is not about conning little old ladies out of their pension - they're strictly major league."

Back at the hotel, Albert's got a mark. Peter Williams is a greedy businessman, keen on making money in shares. The con's a go. Albert ropes him, brings him in, introduces him to the insideman (Mickey) and it's all going to plan - until a knock at the door. It's Danny Blue.



Stacie and Albert are unsure. They're at a crucial stage in the scam; Williams has gone for the convincer and they can't risk losing him now, but Mickey lets Danny have his say. Turns out Danny's good - he's worked out they're doing 'the rag' and joins in, backing up Mickey's story. If he wasn't before, Williams is now convinced - he wants in. Danny's also in - he's made it in to Mickey Bricks' gang.



However, Danny comes down to earth with a bump when he's picked up by two police officers, who are investigating the team. Mickey and his hustlers are going down, there's nothing he can do about that, but the question is - does he go down with them? Danny's offered a deal; tell them everything he knows, or suffer like the rest of them. It's not the easiest of choice.



At the hotel, the culmination of all their work - Williams has arrived with a briefcase full of £50s. Danny arrives, tries to say something to Mickey but they're interrupted by armed police running in. Thing is, will Danny remember the advice Mickey gave him?

"First rule, Danny. Look after number one. If you don't, no-one else will..."

It's not so easy when your team of grifters become family...

description: Albert Stroller is severely beaten by a vicious casino owner, Frank Gorley, after being caught cheating at cards. The team decide to get their revenge by scamming Gorely for a load of money. Finding Gorley's weakness - he's a film buff who particularly likes old black and white movies from the '40s and '50s -the team sets up an elaborate quick-money scheme for him to ... Read all
tags: ['breaking the fourth wall', 'talking to the camera', 'casino', 'dance number', 'reference to james cagney', 'reference to audrey hepburn', 'reference to sylvester stallone', 'revenge', 'film buff', 'cheating at cards', 'hospital', 'fake movie deal', 'script', 'movie production', 'investigation', 'film set']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Mickey and the team get a call - Albert's been beaten up. The perpetrator: one Frank Gorley (played by guest star Robert Pugh), a renowned thug, who happens to own a top London casino. Albert picked the wrong man to cheat at cards with. Gorley's a loner with no real vices. It'll be difficult wreaking revenge, but Mickey's not to be deterred. He sends Ash off to find an 'in'. "No-one puts their hands on Albert."

As Ash discovers, it seems their only way 'in' to Gorley is via his laptop. Danny, desperate to prove himself, following his monumental cock-up in an earlier pigeon con, determines to work something out. Using a deft combination of eye drops, sparkling water and car alarms(!), Ash and Danny not only access Gorley's computer, but download its memory too. It's only a couple more short moves before they discover that Gorley is a film fanatic.

"Showtime!"

Ash calls in several grifters - and favours, Stacie recreates herself as the new Audrey Hepburn and Danny asks Mickey for his promised chance to be the 'Insideman'. Once everything's in place, Mickey gives Danny his final words of wisdom: "Eyes are the window to the soul Danny. Look in his eyes, think like he thinks"

Then, posing as American film producer, Jason Elliott, Danny tips up at Gorley's hotel in a flashy car, 'borrowed' in Mickey's own inimitable way. An intrigued Gorley can hardly wait to meet his movie hotshot guest, and invites Danny along for a drink that very night. He's soon introduced to Danny's fellow 'producers', Mickey and Ash, and between them they convince Gorley to invest in a quick scam, involving extras agencies. Having already read up about Jennifer Cole 'the new Hepburn of the movie world', Gorley's very excited to meet her on the set of her latest film. Of course - to any of us - Jennifer looks remarkably like Stacie in an elaborate costume, but Gorley's none the wiser...The deal goes ahead and Gorley makes £10,000 profit in half an hour.

It's not long before they pull him in for the big con - investing £200,000 in Jennifer Cole's big movie deal in Asia. Gorley's not keen at first but a quick 'reminder' from Danny of James Cagney's vaudeville training and Gorley's convinced.

The deal goes ahead and Gorley hands over a banker's draft for £200,000 - just leaving the team to 'blow him off'. As Danny prepares for his first 'shoot-out', everyone's nervous, but no-one has guessed quite how far Gorley's prepared to go to impersonate his screen idol, Cagney, and it lands one of the team in hospital with Albert.

However, revenge is ultimately sweet - but what is Albert's special surprise?

description: The team focus on the art world and specifically Meredith Gates, an art collector and dealer who is an expert on the works of Mondrian. The plan is to produce a forged Mondrian that would show he experimented with cubism long before Picasso. Having found their forger, they must now provide him with period-specific materials while at the same time setting the trap for ... Read all
tags: ['breaking the fourth wall', 'talking to the camera', 'reference to piet mondrian', 'reference to pablo picasso', 'art collector', 'painting', 'expert', 'forgery', 'fake painting', 'art dealer', 'rat', 'gallery', 'abstract art']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Danny overhears art collector, Meredith Gates (played by Orla Brady), talking big figures and - ever the hustler - pays her gallery a visit. His grifting instincts are right - Meredith's an ideal mark. She's unscrupulous, greedy and selfish, and a huge fan of artist Pier Mondrian, having just bought one of his paintings for £250,000. Mondrian famously went from picture-postcard paintings to abstracts some time after Picasso. As Danny explains to the team, IF a Mondrian painting were discovered in the Abstract style pre-dating Picasso, it would turn the art world on it's head.

"We fake the right painting, and all we gotta tell her is how many noughts we want on the cheque."

It's an interesting proposition, but Mickey has other things on his mind. While he was in prison, Ash and Albert roped a mark and conned him out of £50,000. Only thing is, the mark was broke and now his factory's about to go into receivership. They're jinxed and - according to grifter lore - the jinx will only be lifted if they put things right. They need to find £50,000 NOW. Mickey decides not to tell Danny, and goes along with the art con for a while - to see if it has legs.

Certain his scam's a winner, Danny introduces Mickey to art journalist, Bea Watson, as someone with an interesting art 'discovery'. Mickey tells her there's no story, but this just intrigues Bea more.

"She wasn't interested until she thought I wasn't interested. Now she's intrigued."

Art forger, Tip Jones, is a renowned conman, known for his inimitable forgeries but, disappointingly, Mickey, Albert and Danny find him in a vegetative state following an operation gone wrong. Ever-astute Albert isn't so quick to believe and whispers in Tip's ear he's got a job needs doing. It'll pay £100,000. Suddenly Tip's alert. He agrees to paint a new Mondrian pre-1902, but he's going to need an original work, if they want it done properly. Using a combination of flirting, good timing, glue and toilets, Mickey and Stacie manage to steal a Mondrian without anyone even realising it's missing. Tip begins work on the 'new find'.

Meredith Gates (played by Orla Brady) still needs to be hooked. Thinking he's a fellow art collector, she meets Danny at his 'import/export warehouse'. Gates agrees to match his £250,000 if the new Mondrian painting's proven to be genuine in initial tests.

It all goes to the wire, and there are a few surprises along the way. They just have to lift the jinx, and preferably without Danny realising.

"He hasn't sussed that we're just following a different set of rules to everyone else."

What will he do when he does suss though?

description: Mickey Stone find himself being blackmailed by Victor Maher into helping him catch a bank robber. Maher has an old videotape of Danny Blue involved in a robbery and unless Mickey agrees to help, he will turn it over to the police. Maher spent his career in the fraud squad and is now head of security for Moores Bank. He knows that Sam Richards will soon try to rob the ... Read all
tags: ['breaking the fourth wall', 'talking to the camera', 'bank', 'security', 'trap', 'trick', 'test', 'plan', 'iris', 'blackmail', 'bank vault', 'bank robbery']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Mickey's morning coffee is rudely interrupted by Albert's nemesis, Victor Maher (played by David Calder) - an ex-fraud squad officer, and the only man to have ever put Albert away. Maher 'has something' on Danny, which he'll hand over to the police unless Mickey helps him catch the bank robber who's been plaguing the bank for which he is now head of security.

"When the chance comes to lock horns with the great Mickey Bricks, it's too good an opportunity to miss.""

Maher wants Mickey to befriend the robber, Sam Richards (played by Richard Harrington), then help catch him as he breaks into the London branch. Albert advises Mickey not to get involved - "You can't outsmart him or out manoeuvre him, he knows every trick we do and more besides". But Mickey agrees to the deal.

He thinks it best to tell the team it's just another job, not revealing exactly what's at stake, but asks Stacie to keep Danny out of the way for a while. Albert ropes Sam in, just like any other con and tells him how he knows a dodgy alarms man. Sam's hooked and before long, Albert arranges a meet - with Mickey.

Ash plays the alarms expert and, before long, Sam is telling them how he plans to break into the bank. He explains how his father died while he was just a child, something that rings true for Mickey. Moores Bank robbed his father blind in his hour of need and Sam wants to recover the money his father was owed, together with his priceless diamond.

"I know it sounds stupid, but this isn't about the money."

There's a problem though: Moores' security system needs two people to override it - Mickey agrees to go in with Sam. The second problem: there'll be no way out.

Albert counsels Mickey that, in order to beat Maher, Mickey must tell the rest of the team what's at stake. He does. Danny can't believe that the job is all to save his skin. The team go at the bank job with a new vigour - they want to beat Maher (played by David Calder), save Danny and help Sam Richards, but can they do all three?

The night of the break-in: Mickey and Sam are in the bank and Albert arrives to collect the tape of Danny. Once Sam and Mickey make it into the vault, Maher rushes down to catch them both. But when he gets there - there's nobody in the vault, and no sign of a break-in.

Maher spots a CCTV camera and, finally, he begins to think about the possibilities. Has he actually taken on something - or someone - bigger than he is? Is it possible that Mickey and his team have achieved the impossible and conned him right under his nose?

Later, after Mickey and Sam have said their fond goodbyes, Mickey has one last surprise for Maher, the griftbuster...

description: The con artists set their sights on Katherine Winterbourne a very rich woman, now divorced, whose nasty reputation is well deserved. In her ongoing battle with her now ex-husband, she even killed his dogs. The team's plan is to use her hatred of her ex against her. They set themselves up as investors planning to build a luxury hotel that would compete directly with th... Read all
tags: ['breaking the fourth wall', 'talking to the camera', 'revenge', 'spa', 'ex husband ex wife relationship', 'prostitution ring', 'elevator', 'divorcee']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Mickey sees a newspaper article about a recently divorced businesswoman, Katherine Winterborn (played by Tamzin Outhwaite), who's accused of wreaking revenge on her ex-husband. Katherine is perfect bait for the 'Congreve', an old con which targets bitter, rich women. Albert goes off to do his stuff, and rope her at an art class.

"When he was younger, Albert was the doyen of the 'Congreve'. He could sniff out a vengeful woman like a pig with a truffle."

The team's desperate for a lucrative con, particularly Ash. Mickey's shocked to discover that Ash's ex-wife, fellow con artist June, recently suffered brain damage, whilst doing 'the flop' . Ash has been paying for her care bills in a nursing home, but his money is about to run out. Mickey tells Ash they'll all help to pay - after all, "she's family".

It doesn't go well at the art class. Katherine is rude, cold, and refuses to fall for Albert's charms. It's time for plan B - blatant sex appeal. Danny's obviously keen to give it a try(!) but the con requires experience, so it's up to Mickey to reel Katherine in. She's terrified of lifts, so Ash orchestrates the ideal situation: Mickey and Katherine in a lift, when it suddenly breaks down. The lift is out of action long enough for Mickey to break down Katherine's barriers and by the time they reach ground level, she's offering to take him out for dinner.

Over dinner, Mickey tells her the tale: he's setting up a spa business, to rival her ex-husband's. Katherine wants to help - she knows how spas work, what makes them special, and she also wants to impress Mickey. There's a real spark between them.

Meanwhile, the rest of the team go about setting things up - Danny's meeting architecture students, Stacie's arranging business space and Ash is designing a website. Katherine finally agrees to invest £100,000 in the new spa business but, when Mickey brings her the contract, she's changed her mind.

In the heat of the moment, when both are feeling vulnerable, Mickey breaks all the rules and makes love to Katherine. When Mickey goes to leave, he tells her he's a con man, there was never any spa for her to invest in. "You were rich, bitter, angry, obsessed. You were ripe to be plucked." Shocked, Katherine offers Mickey £250,000 to destroy her ex-husband instead - "a rat to catch a rat".

The team agrees that, if Stephen Winterborn (played by Ben Miles) is as bad as Mickey says he is, it's morally OK for them to go ahead. After all, they need the money. But how can they destroy Stephen? An embarrassed Danny has the answer. He's 'discovered' that prostitutes work at the spa. If this information were made public, it would destroy him, his business and his stock market flotation.

Stacie orchestrates a meeting with Stephen, then introduces him to her 'PR associate' - brilliantly played by Ash. Stephen's presentation is consequently doctored and it's just a case of waiting, then watching his very public downfall.

But during the launch party, alarm bells start ringing for the team. Slowly they realise that Katherine has conned Mickey into thinking that Stephen is the bad person, when it's really her! Katherine has been pulling the strings all along; not Mickey. Could it be that, on this occasion, the con man has been conned...?

description: The mark is Anthony Reeves who has just received a controversial half-million pound payout on being fired from his most recent job. Reeves loves the horses so the team set him up for The Wire - convince him that they are getting race information before it's being made available publicly thereby ensuring a win. The scam works well until one of their previous victims de... Read all
tags: ['breaking the fourth wall', 'talking to the camera', 'horse racing', 'revenge']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Mickey and Danny complete their deal on the 'sale' of the London Eye. Fairground owner, Arthur Bond (played by Philip Jackson), is chuffed with his new star attraction, a bargain at a few thousand quid! Mickey and Danny are happy too - it's another easy con, another job done.

Onto their next mark: Anthony Reeves (played by David Haig), a greedy fat cat who's just got the cream with a golden handshake worth £½ million. A secret gambler and a weakness for prostitutes: the team have their 'in'. Reeves is the perfect bait for 'the wire'. But ...

"No-one's worked the wire in a hundred years".

However, not a team to turn down a challenge, Ash sets up a fake gambling club ('the big store') where the races are delayed by a vital couple of minutes so they see the results before the punter. Fill the club with grifters posing as customers and who'd spot the difference?

Albert's already befriended Reeves through his gentleman's club, so it's just a case of offering him the bait. Enter Danny, as a rogue nephew with insider racing knowledge. A winning tip impresses Reeves and Stacie's killer charm as girlfriend 'Yvonne' soon has him chomping at the bit.

Time to reel him in. When Danny 'confides' that Yvonne, actually a high class escort, can provide names of the winning horse before a race is even run, Reeves wants in. Danny offers to show him his private gambling club, where the bets have no limits.

At the club, the team are all in place: Mickey's the Manager, Ash the man behind the counter, while Albert and Stacie keep tabs in the back office. The plan goes sweetly with Reeves winning £72,000 on a race. Danny and Stacie help him celebrate, but Reeves is cautious - he wants to try another race before betting big.

The team are forced to block him out. Danny takes Reeves back to the club, Stacie calls with the winner's name, but they run the race just as Reeves tries to place the bet. He's too late. Watching the horse romp home he can't believe he's missed out. Next day and it's time for the big one.

"It's a once in a lifetime opportunity, sir. It's now or never."

Stacie makes the call to Reeves who bets £1/2 a million on the horse to win. When the horse only comes third she claims she told Reeves to place the bet not to win. He's distraught but it's too late to get his money back.

To add salt to his wounds, he's besieged by 'journalists' interrogating him about his golden handshake and gambling habit. Reeves makes a hasty retreat, a beaten (and broken) man.

As the team celebrate, gunshots are heard. It's Arthur Bond, demanding the London Eye money he was scammed. It's simple: pay up or get killed. They look from one to the other: any bright ideas?

description: Tony is threatened with criminal negligence after the son of a prominent lawyer hangs himself in his cell.
tags: ['pilot episode']
synopsis_with_character_names:
When officers Caruso and Pagan spot him driving erratically, they arrest Bobby Sturdivant, the son of one of Eastridge's most prominent citizens. However, after Bobby's father insists on leaving him in jail for the night, Bobby uses a belt and hangs himself in his cell. The senior Sturdivant then complains to Mayor Hinton about police negligence in the death of his son and, holding Tony responsible, insists that the Commissioner be excused from the investigation.

When the evidence shows the belt used by Bobby was not his own, the investigation shifts to a mysterious visitor he saw just prior to his death. After telling Sturdivant some unpleasant facts about his son's lifestyle and asking him to stop hounding the police, Tony's investigation is jeopardized when he discovers that Bobby and officer Caruso were dating the same woman. Meanwhile, Tony becomes obsessed with buying a new home in an exclusive part of town.

The investigation uncovers that Bobby was being blackmailed by Artie Briggs, a small time hood who once sold him answers to a law school exam. Bringing Briggs in for questioning, Tony gets Briggs to confess to the shakedown and pushing Bobby to take his own life. After deciding to take on outside work to help pay for the new house, Tony realizes that it would be taking him away from his roots and decides not to buy.

description: The commissioner sets out to trap a serial rapist in a Santa Claus mask who's been terrorizing the city.
tags: ['serial rapist']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Concerned when a rapist and burglar disguised as Santa Claus terrorize neighborhoods throughout the city, Tony insists on an aggressive investigation. Yet, during a routine inspection, he discovers that pair of cops have been sleeping during their night shift and, as a result, may have allowed the rapist to escape. Confronting them about their late-night naps, Tony volunteers for a week of patrol duty to prove that he can still work all night.

While on patrol, Tony uses his wits to calm a violent domestic situation. However, when his partner bursts in, the suspect goes berserk and injures Tony. Still nursing his wounds the following night, Tony answer a burglary call and finds another victim of the Santa Claus rapist.

Tony and his partner escort the victim to the hospital but, when the emergency room physician treats her with indifference, the commissioner threatens him with arrest. After getting the victim to talk about the rape, Tony comes up with some leads, but an error in an arrest allows a likely suspect to go free. Tony then sets a trap at his next likely target and, when the rapist attempts to strike again, he is waiting to arrest him in the act.

description: Rachel refuses to believe Tony when he tells her that her school teacher colleague, Jim Hollister, is a child molester.
tags: ['child molester']
synopsis_with_character_names:
After being named Teacher of the Year, Rachel's friend and colleague Jim Hollister is arrested for drunk driving. However, when a videotape containing child pornography is found in Hollister's car, he becomes the prime suspect in the case of child molestation. Though Hollister disavows any knowledge of the tape and Rachel defends his innocence, Tony tries to get him to admit that he has a problem.

Because the tape cannot be used as evidence, Tony presses Hollister and finally gets him to confess. However, when Hollister's lawyer gets him released because of the illegal evidence used to arrest him, the teacher recants his confession. Meanwhile, Tony panics after forgetting to buy ballet tickets for Rachel's birthday.

Hollister is spotted picking up another child and arrested but when the parents refuse to press charges, Tony's case dissolves once again. After the mother of another victim takes matters into her own hands, Tony talks her out of killing Hollister, even though it leaves him free to strike again. Refusing to be bribed by an offer of ballet tickets, Tony is surprised to find out that Rachel already has them.

description: After receiving a pair of baffling death threats, Tony initiates around-the-clock surveillance of his unsuspecting family
tags: ['death threat', 'deer']
synopsis_with_character_names:
After receiving a well-drawn picture of himself in a death threat, Tony suspects it to be the work of Si Prince, a psychotic and artist whom he sent to prison two years earlier. However, certain that Prince is still in prison, Tony is unnerved to discover another threat at his home. Meanwhile, Rachel takes on a class of six mentally disabled students, while Tony tries to jail a poacher for illegally killing a deer.

Though hoping to keep it quiet, the news of Tony's death threat scares his son David and prompts Rachel's brother Arnie to move out of the Scali home altogether. Tony then learns that Si Prince was recently paroled, while pressure from worried parents and the school administration force Rachel to take time off from her job until the culprit sending the death threats is caught. Angry after calling the bomb squad to investigate a suspicious package delivered their house, Rachel accuses Tony of letting his work effect their family.

After the poacher is brought in again for questioning, Tony extracts a confession of guilt after threatening to hand him over to an angry group of animal rights activists. Upon a visit to Prince's home, Tony discovers that he recently died of cancer. However, when he questions his son Alex, the young man admits to holding Tony responsible for his father's death and confesses to making the threats.

description: Tony starts the review process to become New York police commissioner while investigating the disappearance of two of his police officers.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Police Commissioner Tony Scali is idolized by his police force for his commitment to the job, but despised by those subject to his creative and unorthodox law enforcement tactics. Upon the disappearance of two of his officers, Scali visits the missing cop's wives in an attempt to uncover clues to their whereabouts. Meanwhile, to keep chronic drunk driver Phil Jacobson off the streets, Scali impounds his car while trying to find a way to permanently stop him from driving.

When the missing police cruiser is pulled from the river with the bodies of the two cops inside, Tony calms Officer Stan Kelly, a distraught friend of one of the murdered men. After ordering a thorough examination of the car, Scali sets Kelly off on an investigation to keep him occupied while he pursues the cop killer responsible for the deaths of his men. In the meantime, Jacobson returns to claim his car, but finds it has been completely disassembled and has it returned to him in pieces.

With the murder of another police officer, Scali learns the killer was Carl Slack, an ex-cop whom he personally had discharged from the force. After closing in on him, Scali and Kelly eventually arrest Slack for the three murders. In a test of his ingenuity and compassion, Scali cleverly convinces a man claiming to be a visitor from another planet to go to the hospital for an examination.

description: Tony discovers who is responsible for the disappearance of two of his police officers and a new New York police commissioner is named.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Police Commissioner Tony Scali is idolized by his police force for his commitment to the job, but despised by those subject to his creative and unorthodox law enforcement tactics. Upon the disappearance of two of his officers, Scali visits the missing cop's wives in an attempt to uncover clues to their whereabouts. Meanwhile, to keep chronic drunk driver Phil Jacobson off the streets, Scali impounds his car while trying to find a way to permanently stop him from driving.

When the missing police cruiser is pulled from the river with the bodies of the two cops inside, Tony calms Officer Stan Kelly, a distraught friend of one of the murdered men. After ordering a thorough examination of the car, Scali sets Kelly off on an investigation to keep him occupied while he pursues the cop killer responsible for the deaths of his men. In the meantime, Jacobson returns to claim his car, but finds it has been completely disassembled and has it returned to him in pieces.

With the murder of another police officer, Scali learns the killer was Carl Slack, an ex-cop whom he personally had discharged from the force. After closing in on him, Scali and Kelly eventually arrest Slack for the three murders. In a test of his ingenuity and compassion, Scali cleverly convinces a man claiming to be a visitor from another planet to go to the hospital for an examination.

description: Tony is pursued by a woman he suspects is filing false complaints.
tags: ['hardware store', 'black eye', 'cooking eggs', 'smelly man']
synopsis_with_character_names:
When Michele Carver reports a burglary, Tony doubts her story but tells her to call him at the office if she has any more trouble. Puzzled by her claim that he is her knight in shining armor, when Michele calls again to report another intruder Tony realizes that she is actually pursuing him. Much to the dismay of his fellow officers, Jeff Hartley's religious beliefs prompt him to stop taking baths, while Officer Kelly offers to fix a traffic ticket in exchange for a date with an attractive young neighbor -- and then pays the fines himself in order to keep her interested.

When Rachel suspects Tony of seeing another woman, he refuses to respond to a late night call for help from Michele, only to learn she was taken to the hospital after being beaten by her estranged husband. Though Tony convinces her to get a restraining order to keep him away, Michele decides to drop her complaint after Richard apologizes. Meanwhile, when Tony confronts Officer Kelly about the tickets, Kelly agrees to stop, losing his chances at any more dates.

Officer Hartley files a complaint against Tony but, after having an opportunity to smell him up close, his union representative assures the cop that he could never win his case. . When Rachel goes to see a battered and bruised Michele, Tony realizes that she is still being abused by her husband. Though she insists on giving. him one more chance, when Richard beats her again and Michele finally fights back, Tony arrests him to put an end to the nightmare of abuse.

description: Tony butts heads with both a tough cop who is overzealous in his handling of criminals, and a hard-nosed management consultant hired by the city in a cost-cutting effort.
tags: ['violent cop', 'mugger', 'cop attacked', 'gang']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Although obviously beaten up after his arrest for robbery, Sonny Blake insists that his injuries are the result of an accident. However, when questioned by Tony about the arrest, Officer Peter Cody, an NYPD transferee like Tony, defends his treatment of Blake as necessary to get the job done. Meanwhile, while Tony's police department budget is being reviewed by a notorious management expert, William "The Hatchet" Rathbone, Arnie involves Tony and Rachel's son, David, in one of his business schemes.

Agreeing to ride a shift with Tony, Cody boosts his standing among his fellow cops when he takes on a gang of punks in order to save the commissioner from harm. Told by Tony to work together to find a new crack house before it destroys the Morgan Heights neighborhood, Stan Kelly chooses to use his investigative techniques, while Cody intimidates some of Morgan Heights' teenagers into telling him what they know about the new crack house. When David shows Arnie a news magazine he was reading whose cover story says police officers are no longer heroes, which causes him to question his father's integrity, Arnie defends Tony and his profession.

Meanwhile, Stan finds the crack house, but is surprised to find his police car has been mysteriously stolen and that Cody has already made the bust after claiming he was tipped off by Blake. However, when Tony learns that Blake was coerced into participating in the story and Cody stole the car as a joke, Tony dismisses the renegade cop from the force. Rathbone is given a taste of low-cost police work but when his life is threatened as part of a plan by Tony, he agrees to ease up on his budget cutting. Finally, touched by Arnie's defense of him, Tony arranges for Rathbone to anonymously buy Arnie's latest invention to boost David's confidence in his uncle.

description: Tony is doubly stymied when identical twins both initially confess to the same murder, then, in a surprise about-face, accuse each other of the crime. Also, Arnie finds romance with a kindred soul, a phone-sex operator named Gloria.
tags: ['murder', 'twin brothers', 'real life twin brothers play twin brothers', 'sex line', 'barroom brawl']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Following the murder of Claudia Henderson, her boyfriend Jeffery Borman confesses to the killing. However, when Jeffery's identical twin Greg appears at the station and also admits to Claudia's murder, Tony is left without a solid case against either suspect. Meanwhile, Stan's lack of confidence in his partner Carmela allows a robbery suspect to escape while Tony and Rachel suspect their son David of calling a phone sex line.

Deciding to get the brothers to work against each other, Tony makes up a story about Claudia being pregnant at the time of her death, causing Jeffery to crack and accuse Greg of the killing. Meanwhile, after David claims he had nothing to do with the phone calls, Tony discovers that Arnie has been making all of the phone sex calls. Secretly arranging for the cooperation of the patrons, Carmela takes her partner to the Spinning Wheel Bar and impresses Stan by slugging a customer after telling him it is part of a department ritual.

After Greg tries to recant his confession by claiming he was only trying to protect his brother, Tony takes the twins to the scene of the crime where an unusual error in their stories identifies Jeffery as the killer. While trying to impress another cop, Stan unwittingly attempts to take on the same burly patron as Carmela and causes a riot that nearly destroys the bar. After arranging for him to meet his favorite phone sex operator, Tony and Rachel are surprised when Arnie announces they are headed for Tahiti to get married.

description: A serial killer has been mutilating the bodies of Eastbridge transients and homeless people -- and Tony begins to suspect the perpetrator's identity.
synopsis_with_character_names:
After several homeless men are murdered, Tony suspects there may be a serial killer at work. Though Medical Examiner Dr. Loren Saberhagen insists there is no evidence to prove it, the Commissioner pursues the investigation on his own and insists on attending the autopsy of the latest victim. Meanwhile, Tony becomes a reluctant host of the upcoming Police Commissioner's Ball.

An unhappy and defensive Saberhagen complains to the Mayor in hopes of getting Tony off his back. Then, after reviewing his autopsies of the victims, Tony discovers a series of omissions that suggest Saberhagen could be the killer and decides to exhume the dead bodies. With the murder investigation monopolizing all of his time, Tony asks Rachel to help out with planning the ball.

Tony decides to try and get Saberhagen's confession to the crimes by confronting the medical examiner. After engineering an experiment using a lie detector on the victims during the autopsies, Tony triggers Saberhagen's criminal personality and gets him to admit to the killings. Finally, when one of the commissioners collapses, and after many complaints about the food and decor, Tony and Rachel agree that the ball was a disaster.

description: An elderly woman is killed in her home during the Christmas season and Tony discovers what really happened.
tags: ['christmas episode', 'christmas']
synopsis_with_character_names:
When sixty-nine year old Annette Atkins is found murdered in her home just before Christmas, Tony dismisses Wallerstein's suspicion that her husband Frank and their son are involved with her killing. However, as the evidence continues to suggest murder, Tony proves that Frank bas recently fired a gun, prompting him to admit to the murder. Though claiming he was only fulfilling his wife's last wish that she be allowed to die in peace to end her suffering from cancer, Tony has no alternative other than to arrest Frank for murder.

When a homeless woman is found sleeping in the creche outside city hall, a powerful city councilman, demands that Tony get rid of her. When Tony's efforts fails to get the woman to stop sleeping in the manger, the councilman calls for a special hearing to force her removal. However, upset over Frank's arrest and with having to relocate the homeless woman against her will, Tony resigns and storms out of the meeting.

Upon hearing of the resignation, Frank turns himself in rather than make Tony arrest him. Meanwhile, the City Council bends to the voter's outcry and asks that Tony return to the job without making him enforce the city's vagrancy law. Finally, the District Attorney tells Tony that Frank will not be indicted for the mercy killing of his wife.

description: After Commissioner Scali's friend and colleague, Chief of Detectives Irv Wallerstein, is struck down during a bloody encounter with hijackers, Tony becomes obsessed with finding the assailant!
synopsis_with_character_names:
With a trio of hijackers on the loose, Chief of Detectives Irv Wallerstein asks to be assigned to thecase even though Tony is uncertain he can handle the investigation after being at a desk for so long. However, acting on a tip from Joey Sanderson about the hijackers whereabouts, lrv is shot and seriously wounded during a stakeout. With one of the hijackers in the hospital and Irv's assailant still at large, Sanderson is questioned about the shooting, but the small-time hood denies any involvement beyond giving lrv the tip.

When lrv dies from his wounds, Tony feels responsible for his friend's death and becomes obsessed with finding his killer. After he is questioned again, Sanderson flees but, found hiding in an abandoned building, finally admits to being with a prostitute on the night of the shooting and is dropped as a suspect in the case. Meanwhile, after months of trying, Tony learns that Rachel is pregnant.

Tony puts out the word that the wounded hijacker, Wayne Patrick, has identified his partner, Knox, as lrv's killer. As a result, the triggerman responsible for lrv's death disguises himself as a doctor and infiltrates the hospital in order to silence his partner. Finally, after gaining access to Patrick's room, Knox is arrested for Irv's murder.

description: Vietnamese gangs threaten Eastbridge and Tony steps in to help.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Learning a new restaurant is being harassed by a Vietnamese gang, Tony offers to help but the owner, Manh Sung Duong, resists any police involvement, choosing instead to pay Tuan, the gang's leader, to protect his business. Carmela then suggests that Tony recruit Robert Hue, a Vietnamese police officer and her former boyfriend, but after being approached about the assignment, Hue refuses to help. Meanwhile, Stan goes undercover to stop a series of thefts from pizza delivery boys and David sells Tony's childhood baseball card collection to buy an expensive pair of basketball shoes.

Soon after Tony insists that his officers take a higher profile in the community, Carmela is shot and wounded during the gang's warning to Duong to stay away from the police. Hue then agrees to work undercover but quits after being unable to prevent another attack by Tuan, claiming that Duong and his family are too afraid to help themselves. Stan's late deliveries jeopardize the pizza delivery business, and Tony scolds his son for selling his most prized childhood possession.

Convincing Duong that he can trust the police to protect him if he would only cooperate, Tony finally persuades him to join the fight against the gangs. However, after spotting Carmela together with Hue, Tuan realizes that the restaurants's new employee is a actually cop. When Tuan threatens to kill Duong and Hue, Tony diverts his attention and, in the scuffle, is disarmed and arrested along with his gang. Finally, Stan discovers that the pizza delivery boys were only claiming to have been robbed and keeping the money for themselves, while Tony's spirits are lifted when David tells him that he is his only hero.

description: Tony investigates a 35-year-old murder with the help of an old friend who pays him a visit.
synopsis_with_character_names:
When the trauma of a purse snatching jars her memory, Laura Daley suddenly recalls witnessing her brother's murder when she was only 5 years old. After being led to the skeleton of Steven Daley, Tony and his childhood friend, Paulie Pentangeli, use an old yearbook to track down suspects along with help from Sheila Sorenson, the chairman of the class reunion committee. When Paulie insists that the killer is a former basketball player who is now a priest, he goes to see Father Perella during confession. After Paulie falsely admits to committing a murder, the priest is prompted to revisit the site of the murder, where he is arrested by Tony.

Although Perella admits to killing Steven Daley, he claims it was an accident that resulted from a fight over being taunted about his being caught having sex with a girl. However, when Perella's account doesn't match Laura's recollections, Tony questions whether the priest is really the killer. Then, when Sheila goes to see Perella, she confesses to killing Daley after their fight, knowing her admission must be held in confidence and making it impossible for him to implicate her in the murder.

With the aid of a hypnotist, Laura remembers seeing Sheila crushing the skull of her brother all those years ago. Meanwhile, Perella refuses to say anything about the killing, even though he is told that Sheila is using him to hide her own guilt. Realizing that Laura poses the only other threat to the killer's identity, Tony and Paulie rush to her house and, interrupting a brutal attack, finally arrest Sheila for the murder of Steven Daley.

description: After seeing his mother killed by a stranger, a boy withdraws deep into himself, prompting a sympathetic Tony to step up his efforts to catch the murderer.
synopsis_with_character_names:
While stranded with a stalled car, Jack Sullivan is attacked by a young man who then kills his wife Carol, all within view of their frightened ten-year-old son Mark. Arriving at the scene, Tony and Paulie get only the slightest details of the attack from Jack and Mark, and later learn the boy is a former student of Rachel's who still attends her school for the emotionally disabled. Meanwhile, David cannot bring himself to tell Tony that his basketball team is unhappy with his coaching.

After Caruso and Rose spot a truck fitting the vague description given by Jack that the attacker was driving, they give chase and though the driver manages to escape, he is eventually identified as Mike Welbek. However, when Welbek goes to see Sullivan late that night, he is shot dead and, as a traumatized Mark looks on, Jack plants a knife on the body before calling the police to report killing an intruder. Rachel manages to get Mark to talk about what he saw during the break-in and Tony wonders why Jack didn't mention that his son was in the room at the time and suspects Welbek may have been paid to kill Carol in order to avoid an expensive divorce, and then was killed by Sullivan in order to cover the crime. When he coincidentally shows up at a practice, David enlists basketball legend Wilt Chamberlain to fill in as the team coach in an effort to have Tony simplify his game plan.

When a search of Welbek's apartment uncovers the money he was paid for killing Carol, Tony examines the key he used to gain entry to the Sullivan's house and, finding only Jack's fingerprints, concludes it was planted on Mike after he was shot. Though Jack insists he will never make a case, after having been lured into a confession while offering a bribe to lose the evidence, Tony arrests Jack for the murder of his wife. Finally, even though it costs them a victory in a championship game, Tony takes Chamberlain's advice and lets the team play their own brand of basketball.

description: The unwelcome appearance in Eastbridge of white supremacists leads to a murder, with the suspicion soon arising that one or more of Tony's associates may be implicated.
synopsis_with_character_names:
When white supremacist Sullivan Godfrey comes to Eastbridge to preach his message of racial divisiveness, he and aide Donald Barrett ask for protection after receiving a series of death threats. Learning that Godfrey is planning a march through a racially mixed neighborhood, Tony asks that the demonstration be called off. However, when Godfrey claims he is exercising his constitutional rights, Tony then turns to the neighborhood's leader, Franklin Sharpe, who reluctantly urges calm at a community meeting that is later rocked by a bomb blast. After buying Rachel an expensive ring for their anniversary, Tony is shocked when, after tying it to a balloon to surprise her, it floats out the door.

When Godfrey arrives at the church claiming to show sympathy for the bombing victims, he is attacked by Sharpe. After Sharpe insists the march will not take place in his neighborhood, Godfrey is shot to death in front of his police escorts, and Sharpe is blamed for masterminding the killing. Walter Doyle is arrested and charged with the crime, insisting he worked alone. But Tony is certain of a conspiracy, and perhaps even an informant within his department. Meanwhile, Tony reluctantly asks a psychic to help find the lost ring.

After a phone number in Doyle's pocket is traced to Sharpe, the community leader claims that he had nothing to do with the killing, while Lucille takes Tony's inquiry about her being the informant as an insult and threatens to quit. Deciding to work on Doyle in order to get a confession, Tony arranges for him to escape and is surprised when he heads straight to the late Godfrey's aide Donald Barrett. Caught by the police, Doyle claims that Barrett ordered the killing and the bombing in order to take over Godfrey's hateful organization. Finally, Tony's opinion of psychics changes after one of them finds the ring he bought for Rachel.

description: After he shoots a woman in a drunken domestic squabble, Officer Kelly becomes the victim of a terrorization campaign.
synopsis_with_character_names:
After killing a woman during a domestic disturbance call, Officer Stan Kelly claims he followed department procedures, but his shaky memory of the event makes him an easy target for her husband, who insists the cop had no reason to kill his wife. In court Costello testifies that Stan was right in shooting his wife, raising suspicions that he changed his story under pressure. However, accosting Kelly after the hearing, Costello admits to shortchanging the investigation so that he can kill Stan himself. Meanwhile, after arresting a Cuban diplomat for striking one of his officers, Tony hears from his college friend, State Department official Edward Eggleton, who demands that the prisoner be released in order to head off an international incident.

After Tony announces the upcoming interviews for the "Hot Cops" calendar, several of his officers begin to prepare for the event but their weightlifting causes muscle problems that hamper them in their jobs. Upon receiving a videotape showing Arnie being held in a Chinese prison, Tony turns to Eggleton for help but is rebuked by his old friend. Assigned to a desk job, Kelly receives several threats from Costello before returning home to find that his answering machine has been booby-trapped with explosives. Meanwhile, the calendar's publisher asks Tony to be appear as "Officer April".

Offering himself as bait to catch the deranged widower, Stan fakes his own suicide as Costello is stalking his apartment from the street below. When he goes to see the body at the funeral home, Costello is then surprised when Kelly rises up out of the coffin and arrests him for attempted murder. Still uncomfortable with Mrs. Costello's death, Kelly regains his confidence after saving the life of a young hoy.

description: Tony and Paulie investigate a puzzling arson case in which the husband of a beautiful woman appears to have been murdered.
synopsis_with_character_names:
After a suspicious fire which killed her husband Martin, Catherine Belzer reveals Martin bad been borrowing money from loan shark Benny Gorzo, and that he was working at borne with his business partner, Sam Cole, before the fire. Warned that the police think Martin's death was a murder, Cole worries about being a suspect in the case because of an ongoing affair with Catherine. Though lacking any evidence connecting Gorzo to the case, Tony discovers him and Cole meeting near the loan shark's office. Meanwhile, Tony learns that local antique dealer, Norman Welgrove, has been cheating his customers.

Learning of a large life insurance policy on Martin, Tony and Paulie check on Cole's whereabouts on the night of the killing and find some of Catherine's dresses in his closet, along with a pair of bloody tennis shoes. After lab tests shows the blood to be the same type as Martin's, Catherine admits to her affair with Cole and calls to warn him that the police suspect them of the murder. Though Cole admits to paying off Martin's debt to Gorzo, be denies having anything to do with the killing. Meanwhile, to teach the antique dealer a lesson, Tony buys a watch from Welgrove for $500 and then has Rachel offer him $5,000 for the same timepiece.

When Tony learns that a body disappeared from the hospital where Catherine works be finds that the corpse inside the Belzer's burned out borne was not really Martin's. Tony soon deducts that Martin is actually alive and is trying to collect on an insurance policy while leaving his partner to take the blame for his staged murder. With Stan posing as an insurance investigator, Catherine is alerted to a problem with their policy in order to bring her husband out of biding. Following a frantic Mrs. Belzer, Tony is led to a motel where be arrests her and Martin for insurance fraud and arson.

description: Tony winds up in one of his own jail cells when he runs afoul of an imperious judge who's hiding a fearsome secret.
tags: ["judge's chambers", 'contempt', 'in contempt of court', 'contempt of court', 'jail', 'direct order', 'jail cell', 'bailiff', 'judge', 'insult the judge', 'apology', 'resignation', 'imperious judge']
synopsis_with_character_names:
To avoid parole violation, Joey Sanderson offers information on a break in and rape in exchange for leniency from Tony. Told that Frank and Cory McBride were behind the rape, Tony asks for a warrant, but Judge Scott insists on interviewing the informant himself. When he is unable to produce Joey and is then jailed for contempt, Tony expresses concern over the Judge's unusual request. Meanwhile, after arresting thirteen-year-old car thief, Rip Russo, Carmela offers him a chance to participate in a ride-along program as an alternative to jail.

After buying a gun from a pawnbroker, Judge Scott returns home to find the McBride brothers holding his wife hostage and demanding that he identify the informant. When he tries using the gun to stop their reign of terror, Judge Scott loses the weapon in a struggle and is punished with some painful cigarette burns to his arms. Worried about what will happen to his wife if he doesn't cooperate, the Judge goes to see Tony and pressures him to release the informant's name. While riding with Carmela, Rip escapes after helping to free a friend she tries to arrest for burglary.

Setting a trap for Judge Scott, Tony offers to identify the informant in exchange for money, and is surprised when the Judge agrees to pay. However, after noticing the cigarette burns, Tony realizes that the McBrides are holding the Judge's wife and orders a SWAT team to surround the judge's home. When he leaves the house, Judge Scott is questioned about the McBrides and admits he has been afraid to go to the police. Agreeing to help apprehend the brothers, Judge Scott tells Frank McBride that Joey is the informant and agrees to bring him to a nearby restaurant. With Joey in the car, Scott is surprised when Frank suddenly appears from the back seat, demanding they be driven to the docks. When Frank insists that Judge Scott kill Joey himself, Tony and Paulie arrive in time to prevent the shooting and convince McBride and his brother to surrender. Judge Scott resigns in the wake of the incident, while Rip returns to the ride-along program after Carmela agrees to ignore his escape.

description: Tony attempts to protect an informant from a mysterious hit man, while Stan Kelly enjoys a romantic encounter with a beautiful new Eastbridge arrival.
synopsis_with_character_names:
After Brian Covelle escapes during an undercover bust of an arms smuggling deal, his partners, Ted Warren and Dave Ragsdale, are offered a chance to cooperate in securing his arrest. Although they are quickly bailed out by a noted mob lawyer, after a hit man kills Ragsdale, Warren agrees to cooperate in exchange for protection. Meanwhile, when Tony is desperate to come up with an act for an annual talent show, Rachel suggests that he sing a song.

When Warren implicates local businessman John Malzone in the arms deal, Malzone is followed to a secret meeting and arrested, but Covelle again manages to escape. An accidental encounter at the supermarket gets Stan a date with Lisa, an attractive newcomer to Eastbridge. During a romantic picnic, he accepts Lisa's invitation to join her for dinner if he can find someone to relieve him early from protecting Warren. Meanwhile, Covelle admits to being a federal undercover agent but, refusing to cooperate with a local investigation, asks Tony to stay clear of the case.

When Stan calls to tell her he is coming for dinner, Lisa suddenly claims she is moving to Ohio and must break their date. Then, using Stan's phone call to locate Warren's safe house, Lisa prepares to finish the pair of hits she started with Ragsdale. However, when a shoe found at the scene indicates that Ragsdale's killer is much smaller than originally thought, and noting the mysterious circumstances behind her cancelling Stan's date, Tony concludes Lisa is the killer pursuing Warren. Getting Warren to safety, Tony and Stan are on hand to arrest Lisa before she can complete her deadly assignment. Finally, Rachel saves Tony's act after he gets stage fright and the pair wins the talent show.

description: Tony is embarrassed, then enraged, as a publicity-seeking "video vigilante" metes out even more bizarre and harsh punishment to offenders.
synopsis_with_character_names:
After Julia Green is found beaten into a coma in her dormitory room, Tony and Paulie question her boyfriend, Ryan Gibson. But, when they find a note which suggests an affair with her history professor, and Ryan claims to have seen him leaving the dorm on the night of the attack, Tony turns to Richard Hanick to ask about his relationship with Julia. While he insists they were not having an affair, Banick's alibi doesn't hold up and Tony arrests him for the attack.

Though jailed for the assault, Hanick refuses to divulge that he is really having an affair with his teaching assistant, Michael Harris, while Tony discovers that Ryan has not been truthful about visiting the hospital to see Julia. When a vigilante who videotapes his actions hits town, public support grows as the media coverage makes Tony look ineffective. Though asked not run the Video Vigilante's tapes, pointing to his skyrocketing ratings, the manager of a local TV station refuses to cooperate.

When Tony and Paulie learn Banick was at a gay bar on the night of the attack, he is cleared of the charges. However, insisting on keeping his homosexuality a secret, he is then beaten after his release by the Video Vigilante. Confronted with evidence that he is actually Julia's assailant, when Julia dies, Ryan finally confesses to attacking her. Finally, when Tony stages his own a videotape, the vigilante calls to complain, and is lured to a phony bank robbery where he is arrested.

description: Mike Cermak -- star high-school hockey player, recovering addict, and good friend of the Scali family - becomes a prime drug-ring suspect.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Tony talks with Eastbridge High's hockey standout Mike Cermak about his poor performance during a practice. Although Mike insists that he has not been taking any drugs himself, he does admit to being worried about a friend who is. After counseling Mike to confront his friend, Tony is told of an increase in drug use in nearby towns following Eastbridge hockey games, and jumps to conclude that Mike's own brother, Jeff, is responsible. Meanwhile, a test reveals that Rachel and Tony's baby could be mentally retarded.

After Eastbridge beats Groverton High School, Mike is found dead in the locker room, the victim of an apparent drug overdose. Although told that Mike and coach AI Kennedy argued shortly before his death, Tony asks that Jeff be the one brought in for questioning. Trailing Jeff and watching him buy a gun, Paulie and Tony then follow him to Kennedy's house where, stopped before he can shoot, Jeff accuses the coach of both drug dealing and his younger brother's murder. After breaking the news of the baby to their son David, Tony and Rachel debate having an abortion.

Convinced that Jeff is telling the truth and realizing that Mike must have confronted Kennedy at his suggestion, Tony places the coach under surveillance. After a drug courier is arrested while making a pick up during the game, Kennedy returns to the locker room after a last minute Eastbridge victory, where he is met by an angry Commissioner Scali. Claiming he was forced into dealing in order to pay off money he owed to a group of mobsters, Kennedy confesses to killing Mike to protect his drug operation from being exposed. Finally, with his name cleared, Jeff forgives Tony for suspecting him, while the Scali's decide to have their baby despite the risks.
